etymology.description: 病(病) (bìng, "illness") + 得(得) (de, "complement particle") + 很(很) (hěn, "very") + 重(重) (zhòng, "heavy") indicates the condition of being seriously ill.
etymology.interpretation: This combination conveys the idea of an illness (病) being severe (重) to a degree (很) that is significant or serious (得). It is used to describe a person whose health condition is seriously affected.

examples.chinese: 医生说他病得很重(醫生說他病得很重)，必须马上住院(必須馬上住院)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng shuō tā bìng de hěn zhòng，bìxū mǎshàng zhùyuàn。
examples.english: The doctor said he is seriously ill, and he must be hospitalized immediately.

examples.chinese: 昨晚他熬夜过度(昨晚他熬夜過度)，结果病得很重(結果病得很重)。
examples.pinyin: Zuówǎn tā áo yè guòdù，jiéguǒ bìng de hěn zhòng。
examples.english: He stayed up too late last night, and as a result, he is seriously ill.
